section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Container" means any rigid plastic container or plastic bottle.
"Label" means a molded, imprinted, or raised symbol located on or near the bottom of a container.

"Plastic bottle" means a plastic container intended for single use that:
Has a neck that is smaller than the container;
Accepts a screw-type, snap cap, or other similar closure; and
Has a capacity of at least 16 fluid ounces but less than 5 gallons.

text.section: A person may not distribute for sale in the State any container unless the container is labeled indicating the plastic resin used to produce the container.

section.section:
The label required under subsection (b) of this section shall:
Appear on or near the bottom of the container;
Be clearly visible; and
Consist of:
A number placed within 3 arrows forming a triangle as described in paragraph (2) of this subsection; and
Letters placed below the triangle of arrows.
The 3 arrows shall form an equilateral triangle with the apex of each point of the triangle at the midpoint of each arrow, rounded with a short radius.
The arrowhead of each arrow shall be at the midpoint of each side of the triangle with a short gap separating the pointer from the base of the adjacent arrow.
The triangle formed by the 3 arrows curved at their midpoints shall depict a clockwise path around the code number.

text.section: Any person who knowingly and willfully distributes for sale a container in violation of this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to a fine not exceeding $50 per violation.
The Department shall adopt regulations to administer and enforce the provisions of this section.
